title: Ethereum is a security—CFTC is wrong - CoinGeek
summary: Ethereum is a security, according to the Howey Test, as it meets all four criteria: investment of money, in a common enterprise, with a reasonable expectation of profits, and with profits derived from the efforts of others. This is according to Gary Gensler, chairman of the SEC, and Letitia James, New York Attorney General. However, the CFTC has a different perspective, with Chairman Rostin Behnam stating that ETH is a commodity and falls under their regulatory purview. The legal opinion of these officials and the logic presented suggest that most ICO tokens are unregistered securities and the people involved are legally liable. This may change the future of the industry, with smart developers switching to a "set in stone" protocol like Bitcoin SV.

title: Ethereum: Shanghai withdrawals and recent updates for ETH holders - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum's Shanghai upgrade will unlock $28 billion worth of staked Ether, which was previously unavailable for withdrawal. The upgrade will allow validators to withdraw their rewards, but with restrictions. Only around 1,800 validators will be able to withdraw their entire initial deposit plus rewards each day, and they must specify a withdrawal address manually. The quota is eight complete withdrawals every epoch and is intended to reduce sell pressure on ETH. The upgrade is expected to go live in the first half of 2023, with some analysts predicting it could happen as soon as April 15th.

title: Ethereum Co-Founder Vitalik Buterin Selling ETH Holdings, This Might Be Reason - U.Today
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, recently sold a significant portion of his ETH holdings on the Kraken exchange. This move may indicate an intent to invest in a new project or cover expenses. Buterin has also sold some of his altcoin holdings in the past week, including 9.9 billion CULT tokens, worth 220 ETH.

title: Binance converts $1B BUSD to Bitcoin, Ethereum, BNB - CryptoSlate
summary: Binance converted its $1 billion industry recovery fund to native crypto assets, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, and BNB, due to recent changes affecting stablecoins and banks. The conversion was necessary due to the collapse of crypto-friendly banks and regulatory scrutiny of stablecoins, according to Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao (CZ). The fund was initially in Binance USD (BUSD), but recent events led to the capitulation of several crypto-friendly banks and affected confidence in some stablecoins.

title: Binance Swaps BUSD Stablecoin From 'Recovery Fund' to Bitcoin, Ethereum, BNB - Decrypt
summary: Binance has converted $1 billion of its Industry Recovery Initiative funds from BUSD to Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other digital currencies following the collapse of the USDC stablecoin and the crisis at Silicon Valley Bank. The move comes after Paxos, the owner and issuer of BUSD, was hit by a lawsuit from the SEC and announced it would halt BUSD minting and end its relationship with Binance. The conversion of funds is expected to continue, with some transfers already occurring on-chain. The decision also comes amid a broader market recovery, with Bitcoin trading around $22,280 and USDC changing hands at $0.989.

The Federal Reserve is facing a rate hike decision, and some analysts expect them to pause the hikes due to the banking crisis. Cryptocurrency markets are benefiting from the banking issues, with many altcoins ripping by over 30% in the last day.

title: ETH Staking Not an Investment Scheme, ConsenSys Execs Argue - Blockworks
summary: ConsenSys executives argue that staking rewards in Ethereum are not an investment scheme, but rather a compensation for providing security to the network. They emphasize that staking rewards are not a yield on a loan or a dividend on investment, but rather a mechanism to incentivize network validators to validate transactions and keep the network secure. The declaration comes amid regulatory challenges in the crypto space, with New York Attorney General Letitia James calling ether a security in a lawsuit against a crypto exchange, and the SEC charging Kraken with failing to register crypto staking products as securities. Coinbase's chief legal officer also argues that staking does not meet the Howey Test, which is used to determine whether an asset is a security.

title: Bitcoin Cash outperformed Litecoin and Ethereum Classic in this category - AMBCrypto News
summary: Bitcoin Cash (BCH) has outperformed Litecoin (LTC) and Ethereum Classic (ETC) in terms of decentralization, with a higher hash rate and higher block size. Despite this, BCH's price is still undervalued compared to BTC, but there has been significant whale accumulation in the past week. The recent selloff saw a surge in transaction volume, but the limited upside may be due to selling pressure from addresses holding 100,000 to 1 million BCH.

title: 10,000,000,000,000 Shiba Inu (SHIB) Leaves Large Ethereum Wallets Amid Launch of Shibarium Beta - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Trillions of Shiba Inu (SHIB) tokens are no longer under the control of crypto whales after the launch of Shibarium in beta form. Shibarium is a layer-2 protocol built on Ethereum (ETH). Whale balances have decreased, but the largest 100 Ethereum whales still hold $601.20 million worth of SHIB, representing nearly 12% of their crypto portfolio. Despite the unloading of SHIB from some whales, the value of the dog-themed crypto asset has increased by over 6% in the last 24 hours.

title: Ethereum Price Hold Strong At $1650 But Risk of Pullback Increases - TradingView
summary: Ethereum price has rallied over 15% and broken the $1,650 resistance, but there is an increased risk of a pullback. The price might correct lower and test the $1,625 support zone. The hourly MACD and RSI are losing momentum in the bullish zone, but the RSI is above 60. The major resistance is near $1,700, and a break above it could lead to another major increase towards $1,850 or $2,000. However, if Ethereum fails to clear the $1,700 resistance, it could start a downside correction, with the first support at $1,680, followed by $1,625 and $1,535.

title: Privacy-focused blockchain network closes Aztec Connect tool - Cointelegraph
summary: Privacy-focused blockchain platform Aztec is shutting down its privacy infrastructure tool, Aztec Connect, due to its success in developing a decentralized general-use encrypted blockchain. Aztec Connect, which has over 100,000 users, will be discontinued on March 17, with users able to withdraw their funds without fees for one year. After that, withdrawals will become more difficult. Aztec will also stop running a sequencer, meaning the current system will no longer publish rollup blocks processing Aztec Connect transactions. The firm encourages the community to fork and deploy a new version of the system. Aztec plans to focus on developing its zero-knowledge language, Noir, and the next-generation encrypted blockchain.

title: DigiToads 10x Presale starts As Bitcoin, Ethereum, And BNB Continue To Bounce Back - CoinGape
summary: DigiToads, a new Ethereum-based project, is gaining attention with its innovative features and presale performance. The project has a dynamic pricing model, with each stage of the presale offering a higher price than the previous one. Early investors can potentially see substantial returns on their investments. Meanwhile, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Binance Coin (BNB) have seen a bounce back in their prices, indicating a positive market trend. The recent upswing in these cryptocurrencies could provide a tailwind for DigiToads to gain traction and succeed. To learn more, visit the project's website or register for the presale.

title: How to add Arbitrum to MetaMask: a step-by-step guide - OKX
summary: Arbitrum is a Layer 2 scaling solution for Ethereum that aims to increase transaction speed and reduce gas fees. It accomplishes this by using off-chain computation to process transactions faster and more efficiently. To add Arbitrum to MetaMask, users must ensure they have the latest version of MetaMask (9.5.0 or higher) installed and set up on their browser, and then follow the steps to add the Arbitrum network to their MetaMask wallet. The process is straightforward and can be completed in a few steps. Once added, users can switch to the Arbitrum network and start using it for faster and cheaper transactions.

title: BTC, ETH backtrack losses- Is crypto rout from U.S. bank collapses truly over - AMBCrypto News
summary: U.S. regulators offer bailout to customers affected by SVB and Signature bank collapses, helping to stabilize the crypto market. Bitcoin and Ethereum surge, with stablecoins also seeing a rebound. Crypto companies disclose their exposure to Signature Bank, with Coinbase holding $240m and Paxos holding $250m. Regulators assure depositors that they will be made whole, but the collapse of these banks will impact crypto liquidity, as real-time payment platforms are no longer available.
